thread.title: A Waterfront Rye Estate Lists for $25 Million
thread.title_full: A Waterfront Rye Estate Lists for $25 Million - WSJ

author: Candace Taylor
title: A Waterfront Rye Estate Lists for $25 Million
text:
0 COMMENTS A waterfront estate in Rye, N.Y. with its own sandy beach, rose garden and a main home with a “dog room” is listing for $25 million.
Located about 30 miles from Manhattan on a peninsula known as Parsonage Point, the 2.8-acre parcel has about 350 feet of frontage on Long Island Sound, according to listing agent Penny Weiner of Julia B. Fee Sotheby’s International Realty.
Related Reading
A New York Tudor With a Modern Twist A Waterfront Oasis in New York A Restored Villa on the Long Island Sound Spanning about 8,400 square feet, the five-bedroom house has an elevator, a porte cochere and a pergola surrounded by the rose garden. The master bedroom has his-and-hers walk-in closets and a balcony overlooking the sound. The dog room has a bath area and storage, and the office includes a saltwater fish tank.
Outside there is a heated pool and a pool house with a kitchen, bathroom, changing room and laundry room. There is also a roughly 1,100-square-foot guesthouse with two bedrooms, and a three-car garage with staff quarters above it.
Oliver Stanton, co-owner of privately held commodities trading company Trammo, bought the house in 2011 for $19.75 million. Before buying the house, Mr. Stanton said he and his family had rented an adjacent property. During that time, “I fell in love with the house next door,” he said, and when he learned his neighbors were willing to sell it, he jumped at the chance.
Mr. Stanton said he is selling for personal reasons.
